examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
The bad weather brought famine.
Don’t use bad language.
Bad manners will get you nowhere.
words.defineEn: (of a person) sick or unwell
words.defineVi: (của một người) bị bệnh hoặc không khỏe

examples: I'm sick of your foolishness.
I'm sick of your foolishness.
You get sick to the back teeth with it.
I am sick to death of hearing your excuses.
He was sick of being the butt of their jokes.
words.defineEn: not in a good and healthy physical or mental state
words.defineVi: không ở trạng thái thể chất hoặc tinh thần tốt và khỏe mạnh

examples: The idea was to better the prisoners, not to break them.
And bettering our lives.
If you didn't like it, SUGGEST BETTER PHRASES OF THE WEEK IN COMMENTS.
Both had a passion for bettering the community.
Let's Better Know: Henri Rousseau’s
words.defineEn: recovered from a physical or mental health problem completely or compared to the past
words.defineVi: phục hồi hoàn toàn từ một vấn đề sức khỏe thể chất hoặc tinh thần hoặc so với quá khứ

examples: The surgeon set her broken arm.
This broken promise is a real kick in the teeth for our fans.
He sounds like a broken record.
The X-rays show that he has a broken ankle.
He'd walk around the house repeating his favourite sayings like a broken record.
words.defineEn: cracked or shattered; physically separated into pieces
words.defineVi: nứt hoặc vỡ; vật lý tách thành từng mảnh

examples: Her condition is very serious.
He avoided serious injury following a head-first fall on to the ice.
The thrill-seeker who skydived without proper safety precautions ended up with a serious injury.
Riding a bike without a helmet may seem like harmless fun, but it can have serious consequences.
Touch wood, I've been lucky enough to avoid any other serious injuries.
words.defineEn: bad or dangerous; significant or worrying due to a possible danger or risk
words.defineVi: xấu hoặc nguy hiểm; đáng kể hoặc đáng lo ngại do nguy hiểm hoặc rủi ro có thể xảy ra

examples: A dangerous policy that runs the risk of failure.
These foods are potentially dangerous, yet nobody thinks twice before handing them out to their loved ones.
It's known as the most dangerous part of the city.
When it comes to cybersecurity, there is no little enemy, and even a seemingly harmless email or file can contain a dangerous virus or malware.
The student kept procrastinating on their assignments and projects, and eventually learned the hard way that delays are dangerous when they failed their exams.
words.defineEn: capable of harming or injuring a person or destroying or damaging a thing
words.defineVi: có khả năng làm hại hoặc làm bị thương một người hoặc phá hủy hoặc làm hỏng một thứ

examples: I have a conflicting appointment.
The appointment of a woman was one in the eye for male domination.
you lost me my appointment at London University.
I have a dentist appointment on Thursday.
We have an appointment with the doctor tomorrow morning for a check-up.
words.defineEn: an arrangement to meet someone, especially at a particular time and place, for a particular purpose
words.defineVi: một sự sắp xếp để gặp ai đó, đặc biệt là vào một thời gian và địa điểm cụ thể, cho một mục đích cụ thể

examples: The feeling of sickness soon passed.
Mark's excessive motion sickness during the roller coaster ride forced him to take a break and drive the porcelain bus in the nearby restroom.

I didn't appreciate the little things my body could do, like running and jumping, until I was injured and couldn't do them anymore - health is not valued till sickness comes, and I miss my old abilities.
After an hour of exposure at these levels, radiation sickness sets in.
Maybe you had horrible morning sickness.
words.defineEn: the state of being unwell
words.defineVi: tình trạng không khỏe

examples: Government is taking pain to lessen poverty.
I got a sudden pain in my left eye.
She felt a sharp pain in her hand.
Talking to him took my mind off the pain.
She felt aches and pains in her body after a long day of physical activity.
words.defineEn: unpleasant feeling caused by an illness or injury
words.defineVi: cảm giác khó chịu do bệnh tật hoặc chấn thương gây ra

examples: Accidents like this happen all the time.
That accident battered up the door of my car.
She'll have an accident one day.
The latest skiing accident is a case in point.
Both drivers shared the blame for the accident.
words.defineEn: an unexpected and unpleasant event that occurs by chance, usually causing damage or injury
words.defineVi: một sự kiện bất ngờ và khó chịu xảy ra một cách tình cờ, thường gây ra thiệt hại hoặc thương tích

examples: That team has so many injuries right now that it's given us the edge on them.
The doctor examined her neck for any signs of injury.
He suffered a traumatic brain injury in a car accident.
He avoided serious injury following a head-first fall on to the ice.
Many policies do not protect you against personal injury.
words.defineEn: any physical damage to part of the body caused by an accident or attack
words.defineVi: bất kỳ thiệt hại vật chất nào đối với một phần cơ thể do tai nạn hoặc tấn công

examples: A stable relationship stands the test of time.
The teaching method has stood the test of time.
The English test was no problem for Pedro.
The government is clearly testing the water, to gauge the country’s reactions to their proposals.
The test will involve answering questions about a photograph.
words.defineEn: to examine someone’s body, blood, etc. to find out what is wrong with them; to check someone's health condition
words.defineVi: kiểm tra cơ thể, máu, v.v. của ai đó để tìm ra điều gì không ổn với họ; để kiểm tra tình trạng sức khỏe của ai đó

examples: The doctor examined her neck for any signs of injury.
The doctor examined her body to check for any signs of illness or injury.
She examined the pith under a microscope to study its cellular structure.
We examined the caryopsis of the rice grain under the microscope, observing its unique structure.
She examined the potato closely, noticing the small eye where a new sprout would eventually emerge.
words.defineEn: to look at something or someone carefully to check if anything is wrong with them or to find the faults
words.defineVi: xem xét một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó một cách cẩn thận để kiểm tra xem có gì sai với họ hoặc để tìm lỗi

examples: Their approach to sports teaching broke the mold.
The movie broke all box-office records.
The movie broke box office records in the US.
The bag broke under the weight of the bottles inside it.
My watch has broken.
words.defineEn: to have or cause a crack and a separation in one of the bones of the body
words.defineVi: có hoặc gây ra vết nứt và tách ở một trong các xương của cơ thể

examples: The line cuts the circle at two points.
He's cutting his own throat.
Budget cuts are putting the squeeze on scientific research.
Cutting Jefferson a break?
He really cuts the ground from under my feet.
words.defineEn: to make an incision, opening or a wound in something, especially with a sharp tool or object
words.defineVi: để rạch, mở hoặc vết thương trong một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là với một dụng cụ hoặc vật sắc nhọn

examples: Those coffin nails are going to hurt your voice.
She hurt herself.
I hurt myself by accident.
He was hurt when his friends laughed at him for his taste in music.
Hurting others intentionally is a bad action.
words.defineEn: to cause injury or physical pain to yourself or someone else
words.defineVi: gây thương tích hoặc đau đớn về thể chất cho chính bạn hoặc người khác

examples: The helicopter transported the injured person to the hospital.
The athlete injured his big toe during the soccer game and had to sit out the rest of the match.
The backup quarterback had to make up for the injured starter and lead the team to victory.
Each year thousands of people are killed and injured on the roads.
I used an ice pack to reduce the swelling on my injured knee.
words.defineEn: to get hurt, especially in an accident; to cause physical harm to someone
words.defineVi: bị thương, đặc biệt là trong một tai nạn; gây tổn hại về thể chất cho ai đó

examples: That bacon sandwich really hit the spot!
A cup of coffee hits the spot at any given time.
A car hit the barrier.
The bus hit the bridge.
The woman hit the mugger with her umbrella.
words.defineEn: to accidentally strike a part of our body against something
words.defineVi: để vô tình tấn công một phần của cơ thể của chúng tôi chống lại một cái gì đó

examples: See full dictionary entry for heart.
See my car?
This stadium has seen many thrilling football games.
The twentieth century saw dramatic changes in most areas of life.
Our car has seen better days!
words.defineEn: to consult or have a meeting with a specialist
words.defineVi: để tham khảo ý kiến hoặc có một cuộc họp với một chuyên gia

examples: The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
A vase on a side table caught his eye.
The new law caught them unawares.
He caught a glimpse of his reflection in the glass.
As she turned back, a movement across the lawn caught her eye.
words.defineEn: to get sick, usually with bacteria or a virus
words.defineVi: bị bệnh, thường là do vi khuẩn hoặc vi rút

examples: Well, here' s your chance to give him a taste of the medicine that he prescribes.
And many psychiatrists and doctors will prescribe anti-depressants.
So I prescribed her medication.
Black Americans are prescribed less pain medication than their White counterparts.
So he prescribed me epinephrine
words.defineEn: (medicine) to tell someone what drug or treatment they should get
words.defineVi: (y học) nói cho ai đó biết họ nên dùng loại thuốc hay cách điều trị nào

examples: Guy sneezed loudly.
She sneezed into her elbow to cover her nose.
He sneezes.
Every sneeze starts right inside your nose.
However, this simple sneeze also brings the virus in contact with pets, plants, or even your lunch.
words.defineEn: to blow air out of our nose and mouth in a sudden way
words.defineVi: thổi không khí ra khỏi mũi và miệng của chúng ta một cách đột ngột

examples: You ought to see a doctor about that cough.
She broke the silence by coughing.
The doctor has given me some medicine to take for my cough.
It just goes to show that love and cough cannot be hidden.
He enjoys a spoonful of honey before bed to help calm his cough and promote a good night's sleep.
words.defineEn: to push air out of our mouth with a sudden noise
words.defineVi: để đẩy không khí ra khỏi miệng của chúng tôi với một tiếng ồn đột ngột
